title: Biography
text:
Biography


Welcome to my research portfolio!


I am currently a CNRS postdoctoral researcher at the LOCEAN laboratory in Paris, working on the spatial distribution and diversity of zooplankton and phytoplankton using quantitative imaging and machine learning techniques.


My research integrates environmental and biological data to investigate spatial distribution of zooplankton and phytoplankton as well as their role in the biological carbon pump.




Skills



Machine Learning & Data Analysis


Quantitative Imaging (UVP5, ZooScan)


Oceanographic Data Processing


Statistical Modeling


Scientific Writing & Communication


Programming (R, Python)


GIS and Spatial Analysis





Research Interests



Marine Plankton Ecology


Biological Carbon Pump


Ocean Biogeochemistry


Climate Change Impacts on Marine Ecosystems


Biodiversity and Ecosystem Functioning


Marine Conservation


Innovative Sampling Technologies in Oceanography

title: Laetitia Drago
text:
Post-doctoral position: Machine learning and marine data


March 2024 – Present

LOCEAN Laboratory, Paris
Funding: NECCTON Horizon Europe project

Spatial Distribution of Taxonomic and Functional Diversity of Zooplankton in the Iroise Sea Marine Park (PNMI)
Use of quantitative imaging data (Zooscan), metabarcoding, environmental data and machine learning techniques
Investigation of the relationship between functional diversity and environmental factors




PhD: Global Analysis of the Biological Carbon Pump Using Quantitative Imaging Data


2020 - 2023

LOV UMR 7093, Villefranche sur mer, Sorbonne Université
Funding: 50% H2020 European project TRIATLAS and 50% Ecole Doctorale 129, Sorbonne Université

Spatial Distribution of Zooplankton Biomass Using Quantitative Imaging Data (UVP5) and Machine Learning (niche modeling)
Compilation of imaging and climatological data (WOA, Copernicus, NOAA)
Export phenomenon in the North Atlantic during the EXPORTS campaign, 2021
Scientific campaigns at sea: Norwegian Fjords and North Atlantic




Master 2 internship: Global Distribution of Macroplankton Biomass Estimated by In Situ Imaging


2020 (6 months)

LOV UMR 7093, Villefranche sur mer, Sorbonne Université

Spatial Distribution of Zooplankton Using Quantitative Imaging Data (UVP5) and Machine Learning (Niche modeling)
Analysis of a large dataset from 25 oceanographic projects




M1 Internship: Numerical Simulations of Larval Dispersal of Paramuricea clavata


2019 (2 months)

LECOB UMR 8222, Banyuls sur mer, Sorbonne Université

Lagrangian models of larval dispersal and population connectivity

title: Laetitia Drago
text:
Education

2022: FIDLE Introduction to Deep Learning, CNRS (17h)

Convolutional neural networks, evaluation of regression and classification models, sequential and temporal data. Theory and practice (Python).

2022: Ocean Litteracy, Sorbonne Université and IMBRSea (3 weeks)

Communicate with different types of audiences (age, profession) using innovative learning methods.

2021: Machine Learning 4 Ocean (ML4Ocean), Sorbonne Université (1 week)

Summer school on the use of artificial intelligence tools and machine learning in oceanography. Theory and practice (Python).

2018 - 2020: Master degree of Marine Sciences, Sorbonne Université

Functioning of marine ecosystems and global changes course obtained with honors.
Functional ecology, oceanography, modeling, data processing.

2018: Multivariate analyzes for marine ecology, Sorbonne Université (3 weeks)

Environmental data analysis methodologies. Theoretical and practical (R).

2015 - 2018: Bachelor of Science in Life and Health, Université de Nice 

Biology of Organisms and Ecosystems course, obtained with honors.
Ecology, diversity of organisms and ecosystems, statistics, genetics.

2020 - 2023: Co-organizer of “LOV Student Seminars”

Welcoming new PhD students and interns, organizing practice sessions for thesis defenses, and themed seminars

2022-2023: OSU-STAMAR Council

Advocating for doctoral students’ interests, contributing to decision-making processes, and fostering communication between students and laboratory.

2018 - 2020: Co-organizer of “Green Lunch”

Organising weekly debates on environmental protection and sustainable development

title: Laetitia Drago
text:
Teaching and Communication

May 2024 (6h): Green Ocean Course, ENSTA, Paris

Classes on Marine plankton diversity and biological invasions

March 2024 (3.5h): Tara Ocean QLife Winter School, ENS, Paris

Practical work on zooplankton distribution and in situ imaging data on R

2022 - 2023 (128h): Teaching Assistant Contract, 128h, Sorbonne University

Lectures and practical work with undergraduate and master’s students on modeling, taxonomy, and plankton diversity.

2023: Pint of Science“The Study of Zooplankton”

Public outreach on zooplankton research

Co-supervision of Internships

Bachelor’s 2nd Year: “Impact of the coastal front on phytoplankton dynamics in the Iroise Marine Natural Park”, Sophia Mastouri, 2 weeks, 2024
Master’s 2nd Year: “Impacts of zooplankton on the carbon cycle of the equatorial Atlantic”, Hélène Thibault, 6 months, 2022
Master’s 1st Year: “Study of zooplankton communities along the equatorial Atlantic”, Hannah Haines, 2 months, 2021

2021 - 2022: Participation in EXPORTS Project Communication Campaign

Campaign postcard to NASA
Interviews with the science communication team, Dive and Discover
“Imaging the Ocean”, blogpost for NASA Earth Expeditions

2021 - 2023: Scientific Animator, Petits débrouillards

Organized activities for various audiences, particularly on seas and coastlines.

2020: Translation of PlanktonID website

English to French translation: PlanktonID Website

title: Laetitia Drago
text:
Reports

PhD Thesis: Image-based global analysisof the biological carbon pump, Laboratoire d’Océanographie de Villefranche (LOV), Sorbonne Université, Supervised by Pr. Lars Stemmann and Pr. Rainer Kiko, https://theses.hal.science/THESES-SU/tel-04483392v1


Master 2 internship: Global distribution of macroplankton biomass estimated by in situ imaging, Laboratoire d’Océanographie de Villefranche (LOV), Sorbonne Université, Supervised by Dr Jean-Olivier Irisson, Pr. Lars Stemmann and Dr. Thelma Panaïotis.


Master 1 internship: Numerical simulations of larval dispersal of Paramuricea clavata, Laboratoire d’Ecogéochimie des Environnements Benthiques (LECOB), Sorbonne Université, Supervised by Dr. Katell Guizien.

title: Laetitia Drago
text:
Talks

April 2024 : “Global distribution of zooplankton biomass estimated by in situ imaging and machine learning”, SAMA, Paris, France (presentation)
June 2023 : “North Atlantic biological pump dynamics in an eddy revealed via in situ imaging”, ASLO, session Biological Pump Dynamics and Trophic Transfer in Pelagic Ecosystems of the Atlantic, Espagne (presentation)
October 2022 : “Global distribution of zooplankton biomass estimated by in situ imaging and machine learning”, TRIATLAS General assembly, en ligne (presentation)
September 2022 : “Global distribution of zooplankton biomass estimated by in situ imaging and machine learning”, Séminaire du LOV, Nice, France (presentation et poster)
September 2021: “Image-based analysis of the Global Distribution of Zooplankton Biomass Through a Habitat Modeling Approach”, TRIATLAS General assembly en ligne (poster)
July 2021 : “Global distribution of macroplankton biomass estimated by in situ imaging”, ASLO session Imagine/Imaging the Ocean – Pelagic imaging for a sustainable future, en ligne (presentation)
